verb.definition: To express or represent something as a vector (informal/constructed usage)
verb.example: In the physics simulation, they vectored the forces to compute direction and magnitude.

noun.definition: A quantity having direction as well as magnitude, especially in physics and mathematics
noun.example: Velocity is a vector because it has both speed and direction.

usage_examples: The engineer represented the force as a vector on the graph.
Ticks can be vectors for Lyme disease.
In graphics programming, they vectored the movement of the object.
